cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: over southern Dominican Republic, about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then turn northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northwest Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (near Cameron/Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches posted for parts of the central Bahamas, Andros Island, Florida Keys and several western Cuban provinces (no Texas coast watches yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for portions of Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, and eastern-central Cuba (no Gulf Coast warnings yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles now, potential impact zone along the northwest Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast to Louisiana mid-week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely based on current track (heavier cores expected east of Houston)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely unless future track shifts west
weather_observation.wind: Low (11%) chance of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds; stronger gusts possible if track shifts closer
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water level rises possible; significant surge not expected for upper Texas coast on present track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1â€“3 inches; current guidance keeps the heaviest rain well east
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased swells and short-notice USCG port condition changes could disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo operations
